title.narrative: Project development of contribution in labour rights
Projektutveckling av insats inom anständigt arbete

description.narrative:
Insatsen är av förberedande karaktär och syftar till att utveckla ett nytt projekt med det övergripande målet att öka kapaciteten hos relevanta aktörer i Rwanda att främja förbättrade arbetsvillkor och tillgången på anständigt arbete, särskilt inom den informella ekonomin. Projektutveckling med tillhörande workshops och möten med nyckelaktörer kommer att genomföras i maj och juni 2017 av International Labour Organisation (ILO).
Insatsen ska resultera i ett projektdokument för att främja förbättrade arbetsvillkor i den informella ekonomin.

This contribution is of preparatory nature and the purpose is to enable the development of a new project with the overall objective to enhance capacity with actors in Rwanda to promote improved labour rights and decent work, particularly in the informal economy. The process of developing the project document as well as validation workshops with key stakeholders will be carried out in May-July 2017 by the International Labour Organisation (ILO).
The contribution shall result in a project document for promoting labour rights in the informal economy.

participating-org.narrative: International Labour Organisation - Regular Budget Supplementary Account

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This contribution was of preparatory nature with the purpose to enable the development of a new project with the overall objective to enhance capacity with actors in Rwanda to promote improved labour rights and decent work, particularly in the informal economy. The contribution involved developing a project document as well as dialogue and validation workshops with key stakeholders. The contribution resulted in the follwing deiverables: - A complete Project Document, including problem analysis, theory of change, strategy and logical framework, direct and ultimate target groups, stakeholder mapping, partner selection, risk analysis, institutional framework and management arrangements with draft job descriptions for key staff, sustainability strategy, monitoring and evaluation arrangements, knowledge sharing and communication, project budget and a tentative implementation plan. - A sector selection report with identified sectoral decent work deficiencies, including gender and youth mapping and a plan for developing a gender and youth strategy in the beginning of the project implementation. - A brief report regarding deficiencies of the current labour legislation and practice in relation to International Labour Standards. - A validation workshop report regarding the project design held for representatives from the stakeholder organisations. The project development also resulted in close dialogue between the Embassy, ILO and Sida HQ regarding decent work in the informal economy and relevant approaches.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
